<title
    level="1"
    right="Armor 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Splint Mail](/Armor.aspx?ID=48)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 273 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 13 gp

**AC Bonus** +5

**Dex Cap** +1

**Check Penalty** -3

**Speed Penalty** -10 ft.
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Strength** +3

**Bulk** 3

**Category** Heavy

**Group** Composite
</row>

</column>

---

This type of armor is chain mail reinforced with flexible, interlocking metal plates, typically located on the wearer's torso, upper arms, and legs. A suit of this armor comes with an undercoat of [padded armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=3) (see above) and a pair of [gauntlets](/Weapons.aspx?ID=4).

<title level="2">Armor Specialization Effects</title>

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 275 <sup>4.0</sup>

Certain class features can grant you additional benefits with certain armors. This is called an armor specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which armor group your armor belongs to, as listed below. Only medium and heavy armors have armor specialization effects.

[Click here for the full rules on Armor Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=211).

<document level="2" id="armor-group-2" />

<title level="2">Specific Magic Armor</title>
[Life-Saver Mail](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2808), [Mariner's Splint](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3274)
name: Splint Mail
